594442188.name: Excellent! 2 different trails Easy and...really hard.
594442188.author: a TripAdvisor user
594442188.reviewBody: Excellent! 2 different trails Easy and...really hard. Choose wisely. Bring water and REAL shoes for hiking. The views are amazing.

address.streetAddress: SON 124 to Camino a Playa Las Tetas

555533385.name: #1 rated ocean viewpoints!
555533385.author: a TripAdvisor user
555533385.reviewBody: Climbing enthusiast? then you MUST visit this place and get to the top of the famous "Cerro Teta Kawi", you\'ll take your best photos once you get to the top!

address.streetAddress: SON 124 to Camino a Playa Las Tetas

523910600.name: Stunning views
523910600.author: a TripAdvisor user
523910600.reviewBody: Nice hike ..be ready to go uphill with no trails..( it has some but you will get lost, very slippery coming down the hill be really careful and bring plenty of water, try to go the earliest in the morning ( I went in july and was sweating a lot ) bring cell phone and never try going up by yourself. going up and down will take you about 2 hours just take your time and be safe!!!!!!!

address.streetAddress: SON 124 to Camino a Playa Las Tetas

497172758.name: Awesome views!!
497172758.author: a TripAdvisor user
497172758.reviewBody: The trail is clear of obstacles. There are two trails (one for each of the peeks). Preferential wear hiking shoes  (tennis are OK, but friction shoes are better). Bring plenty water, sun protection since it is not shade at the trail. Sunscreen is a must! And some snacks.\nThe trail (entrance by the highway) is gentle most of the way, until you get closer to the top. Uphill is slippery due to small rocks. I do not recommend this hike for children and people out of shape! The hike brings awesome views of the bay. Enjoy the summit!!

address.streetAddress: SON 124 to Camino a Playa Las Tetas

483748608.name: Desierto junto al mar
483748608.author: a TripAdvisor user
483748608.reviewBody: There is a superb view from this hill towards the bays, and the contrast of the dessert meeting with the sea is gorgeous. Highly recommended to see the sunset from the "mirador".

address.streetAddress: SON 124 to Camino a Playa Las Tetas

469733554.name: Great morning hike
469733554.author: a TripAdvisor user
469733554.reviewBody: Did this as a solo climb around 8:30 am in late March.  Based on previous reviews , I brought back pack with water and camera, sturdy hiking shoes and a hiking pole. As others have indicated expect that it will take an hour from the trailhead until you crawl through the pierced rock in the southern peak. I did not see a distinct trail to the saddle between the peaks or the north peak. Lower third is easy but with numerous false trails that peter out. The middle third has a lot of fist-sized loose rocks within the trail which changes to fine sand in the upper third so gloves or poles are strongly recommended if you are an occasional hiker. It will take ten minutes off your descent time and may prevent a slide or turned ankle I spent a half hour near the summit just watching the birds glide on the thermals coming off the rocks.  Bring a small garbage bag to take away some of the garbage and make sure to move larger rocks off the main trail for the next hiker. The trail paint markings are much more prominent on the descent

address.streetAddress: SON 124 to Camino a Playa Las Tetas

467897717.name: Challenging, but definitely worth it!
467897717.author: a TripAdvisor user
467897717.reviewBody: My friend and I camped below the peak the night before and started our hike around 6am. We are both experienced hikers, and it took us about 1.5 hours to get to the top, and 1 hour to get to the bottom again. The hike is a very steep uphill incline, but short. The last little bit to the top requires some tricky maneuvering and bouldering up the face of the peak, but if you go are careful it is an exhilarating and rewarding climb with unparalleled views!

address.streetAddress: SON 124 to Camino a Playa Las Tetas

453982138.name: The Perfect Hike
453982138.author: a TripAdvisor user
453982138.reviewBody: Best to hike early as you can do the entire hike up in the shade. Expect about one hour to summit. No guide needed unless you want to rope up and rock climb to the final summit.

address.streetAddress: SON 124 to Camino a Playa Las Tetas

451794352.name: Best view of San Carlos!
451794352.author: a TripAdvisor user
451794352.reviewBody: I have hiked to the summit(s) of Tetakawi several times, and I\'m awe inspired by the view every time. There are 2 routes, one from the highway side and one from Piedras Pintas beach. Both offer unique views while heading up.\nWear good hiking boots if you have them (tennis shoes will work also, but definitely no sandals). Plan for 3 hours total, as you will want to spend plenty of time at the top. Bring plenty of water and a snack, sunscreen and camera, gloves can be useful too with sharp rock and some scrambling you have to do near the top if ascending the highway side. Start early especially in the hot and humid summer months. \nENJOY!

address.streetAddress: SON 124 to Camino a Playa Las Tetas

435371558.name: Incredible view
435371558.author: a TripAdvisor user
435371558.reviewBody: The trail leads you very clearly to the top o Tetakawi. If you take the access from the beach you can enjoy the best view from top and you can cool down in the sea right after. Climbing early in the morning is way better in order to get the best weather!

address.streetAddress: SON 124 to Camino a Playa Las Tetas

430383117.name: 1.5 mile straight up!
430383117.author: a TripAdvisor user
430383117.reviewBody: Took off early but it was still hot on the way down. Quite a workout straight up but well worth it at the top as the views were amazing!\nTake plenty of water and a camera!\n

address.streetAddress: SON 124 to Camino a Playa Las Tetas

415154274.name: Best view of any coastline
415154274.author: a TripAdvisor user
415154274.reviewBody: The climb if Tetakawi is a nice easy climb of around 600 meters and can easily be accomplished in an hour up. Best to do early morning and the views of San Carlos coastline cannot be beaten than from here. Take your camera and plenty of water.

address.streetAddress: SON 124 to Camino a Playa Las Tetas

393544244.name: a nice climb and great views
393544244.author: a TripAdvisor user
393544244.reviewBody: climb in the winter.  My captain says too many snakes in the summer.  Take a camera.  It is worth a few hours of time.

address.streetAddress: SON 124 to Camino a Playa Las Tetas

386219865.name: Worth the hike!
386219865.author: a TripAdvisor user
386219865.reviewBody: Hiking up the mountain was definitely difficult (and very hot at 9 am in June!) but once we made it to the top the views made up for it! It took about an hour for us to get to the top from the trail-head off of the main road. I would recommend sturdy hiking boots with good tread. The hike down is maybe even more difficult because of the steep trail and loose gravel - we had a few falls even going slow. All in all, it was worth it and I would recommend it to anyone who is in good enough shape to hike it.

address.streetAddress: SON 124 to Camino a Playa Las Tetas

368130758.name: Difficult Hike, Come Prepared!
368130758.author: a TripAdvisor user
368130758.reviewBody: This hike gives way to some beautiful views. We had walked for three hours before embarking on this hike and weren\'t in proper foot wear. I won\'t do that again! There is limited bus and taxi service so we ended up walking for hours and then deciding to check this out. It doesn\'t take long before the trail becomes very steep, with no shade, and little for hand and foot holds. We actually watched 2 people above me fall and slide to somewhere beneath me. Luckily they both appeared to lack serious injury. Both my spouse and I were hit by falling rocks, made loose by climbers ahead! My ankle took a direct hit and a couple weeks later is still healing. We did bring lots of water and wore hats which is a must. We stopped maybe 15 minutes before the summit because of not being properly prepared and wanting to be safe. Shortly after seeing people fall (who were properly prepared), we descended.\nWe will be back in the area again and look forward to the hike when prepared: lots of water, hat, prearranged transportation to and from hike entrance, sturdy footwear, knowledge that this is a steep difficult hike!

address.streetAddress: SON 124 to Camino a Playa Las Tetas

355627950.name: Amazing Experience and Views
355627950.author: a TripAdvisor user
355627950.reviewBody: It\'s a 2 to 3 hours hike with amazing views of the Sea of Cort\u00e9s in fact once you reach one the top of the mountain you can see at the distance La Baja. Sometimes during the weekend its a crowded hike but if you start early of late for the sunset definitely will be a great experience.\n\nA lot of water needed during the summer to prevent dehydration.

address.streetAddress: SON 124 to Camino a Playa Las Tetas

655851588.name: Great Birding spot
655851588.author: a TripAdvisor user
655851588.reviewBody: Great birding spot with easy access from two different roads, one can pay a fee and get a guided tour of the area or use the road to the north with free access and just as good birding, great views to Tetakawi.

itemReviewed.name: Estero el Soldado, Area Natural Protegida

address.streetAddress: Carretera las Tinajas - Guaymas Kilómetro 1.8 a la derecha, con estacionamiento

654611929.name: Bird Lover\'s Paradise
654611929.author: a TripAdvisor user
654611929.reviewBody: Birders will find hundreds of species, including a flock of roseate spoonbills, making their home in this protected estuary. All you need are binoculars and some good hiking shoes for uneven ground.

itemReviewed.name: Estero el Soldado, Area Natural Protegida

address.streetAddress: Carretera las Tinajas - Guaymas Kilómetro 1.8 a la derecha, con estacionamiento

647411951.name: Kayaking in calm waters, lots of birds, watch out for stingrays
647411951.author: a TripAdvisor user
647411951.reviewBody: We launched our kayak at the Bahia Delfines condos and paddled down to the Estuary. Tide was still ebbing so the current coming out was pretty strong so we beached the kayak and walked along next to the beach until we got past the strongest current. That\'s when we saw the first stingray. They apparently come into the estuary to breed and lay their eggs. This one was just barely visible partially buried in the sand. You really don\'t want to step on one as they can sting you with a nasty barbed stinger at the base of the tail. It\'s not poisonous but it is dirty and can cause a nasty infection, so always wear those thick soled water-walkers and shuffle your feet as you walk along. Tons of birds, white Pelicans, roseate spoonbills, oyster catchers, sanderlings, heron\'s all of which don\'t seem very concerned about us paddling by. You can rent kayaks from the Pilar rental place. Highly recommended.

itemReviewed.name: Estero el Soldado, Area Natural Protegida

address.streetAddress: Carretera las Tinajas - Guaymas Kilómetro 1.8 a la derecha, con estacionamiento

621676702.name: visit the sea life
621676702.author: a TripAdvisor user
621676702.reviewBody: This is a great place to kayak, enter from the beach side and you can paddle right up to the marine life

itemReviewed.name: Estero el Soldado, Area Natural Protegida

address.streetAddress: Carretera las Tinajas - Guaymas Kilómetro 1.8 a la derecha, con estacionamiento

617729636.name: Great Kayak with Dolphins and Lots of Birds!
617729636.author: a TripAdvisor user
617729636.reviewBody: We began our kayak from the beach just south of Condos Pilar. The kayak began auspiciously with a small pod of Dolphins that interacted with us for 5-10 minutes before continuing on their way. We then paddled through the inlet into the mangrove estuary. Very beautiful. Many wading and fishing birds. Do bring your binoculars. We paddled in and out of the estuary on the flood tide and the current was manageable. Highly recommended!

itemReviewed.name: Estero el Soldado, Area Natural Protegida

address.streetAddress: Carretera las Tinajas - Guaymas Kilómetro 1.8 a la derecha, con estacionamiento

612400003.name: Nature at its best!
612400003.author: a TripAdvisor user
612400003.reviewBody: We stayed at a condo next to this Estero so we walked the beach here everyday.  The local fishing boats catch fish, filet them and then dump the carcasses overboard.  Many of the fish wash up onto this beach...and I mean hundreds of them. What a shame.

itemReviewed.name: Estero el Soldado, Area Natural Protegida

address.streetAddress: Carretera las Tinajas - Guaymas Kilómetro 1.8 a la derecha, con estacionamiento

603521388.name: great swim in beautiful water
603521388.author: a TripAdvisor user
603521388.reviewBody: if you are lucky you will see dolphins in the bay....wild place and will find tranquility...very clear sea and white send

itemReviewed.name: Estero el Soldado, Area Natural Protegida

address.streetAddress: Carretera las Tinajas - Guaymas Kilómetro 1.8 a la derecha, con estacionamiento

571000815.name: Nice beach walk.   Stinking garbage at parking area.  Not many birds
571000815.author: a TripAdvisor user
571000815.reviewBody: The parking area at the Estero de Soldado was the start of the disapppointments.   The trails into the area were fenced off.  Access to the area from the parking lot was not allowed.  The parking area reeked, from a huge pile of garbage in the northwest corner of the lot.   We walked past the garbage pile to the beach, which is very nice, and "south" toward the estuary inlet.   At the estuary inlet we did see a few birds, including some terns, gulls, curlews, grebes and small herons.    Further from the parking area there was no fencing protecting the lagoon and people had driven their cars over the adjacent flat scrub.    Certainly this estuary was not as accessible nor pristine as it was in the past.

itemReviewed.name: Estero el Soldado, Area Natural Protegida

address.streetAddress: Carretera las Tinajas - Guaymas Kilómetro 1.8 a la derecha, con estacionamiento

565900554.name: Great birding.
565900554.author: a TripAdvisor user
565900554.reviewBody: Great birding spot just outside town, beautiful views with a great variety of land and sea birds. Go in early morning on early evening.

itemReviewed.name: Estero el Soldado, Area Natural Protegida

address.streetAddress: Carretera las Tinajas - Guaymas Kilómetro 1.8 a la derecha, con estacionamiento

537921477.name: Peaceful beach walk
537921477.author: a TripAdvisor user
537921477.reviewBody: Have been to Estero el Soldado twice this week. Our dogs love it there. The water is warm at this time of the year (Nov). Saw a pod of dolphins this morning. Worth the 10 min drive from where we are staying in Hermosa area.

itemReviewed.name: Estero el Soldado, Area Natural Protegida

address.streetAddress: Carretera las Tinajas - Guaymas Kilómetro 1.8 a la derecha, con estacionamiento

495514644.name: One of most beautiful view in the world,2 Amazing visits so Far !
495514644.author: a TripAdvisor user
495514644.reviewBody: We stayed at Bahia Delfin area, its a paradise ,amazing sunset,colorful sky,every night , Dolphins families come early in the morning with beautiful show on the beach , I believe this area is one of the most beautiful view in the world !

itemReviewed.name: Estero el Soldado, Area Natural Protegida

address.streetAddress: Carretera las Tinajas - Guaymas Kilómetro 1.8 a la derecha, con estacionamiento

487552671.name: 2nd visit
487552671.author: a TripAdvisor user
487552671.reviewBody: This place is beautiful. I\'m glad something like this exist. Not only does the guide teach you the importance of protected areas like this one but you also get the experience to kayak around this area. Well located,  paved roads, knowledgeable guides that make you feel safe. The depth of the water is only about 3 1/2 feet. Safe for all ages.

itemReviewed.name: Estero el Soldado, Area Natural Protegida

address.streetAddress: Carretera las Tinajas - Guaymas Kilómetro 1.8 a la derecha, con estacionamiento

474364442.name: A beautiful protected area
474364442.author: a TripAdvisor user
474364442.reviewBody: It is still protected.  This place needs help staying protected.  From White pelicans to Roseate spoonbill there are a multitude of beautiful birds in this Mangrove estuary.  It\'s a fantastic place to kayak during a high tide or wade during a low tide.  Let\'s not let this special natural place be spoiled by "eco-tourism".

itemReviewed.name: Estero el Soldado, Area Natural Protegida

address.streetAddress: Carretera las Tinajas - Guaymas Kilómetro 1.8 a la derecha, con estacionamiento

465106106.name: Beautiful and lush setting for kayaking or just hanging out.
465106106.author: a TripAdvisor user
465106106.reviewBody: On the East end of Bahia Delfin, this slice of paradise is a birders dream. We saw Rosette Spoonbills, White Pelicans, Turns, Ospreys and a plethora of others that I can\'t begin to name. Watch the tide chart and get into the estuary in a kayak for a close up look at all of these guys, or just park by the Condomineos Pilar and walk to it. Please be aware that this is a protected area and that dogs are not allowed even though many of the residents of the condominiums ignore this restriction and regularly walk their pooches there. On the beach side look for regular sitings of Dolphin pods too.

itemReviewed.name: Estero el Soldado, Area Natural Protegida

address.streetAddress: Carretera las Tinajas - Guaymas Kilómetro 1.8 a la derecha, con estacionamiento

442647493.name: Great for bird watching
442647493.author: a TripAdvisor user
442647493.reviewBody: This preserve is great for shore bird watching.  We were on foot this time, but have kayaked into the estuary from the Condominos Pilar beach in the past.  Informal trails are not marked but it would be hard to get last.  While the tide is going out, its fun to watch predatory fish and birds at the mouth of the estuary, feeding on the schools of sardines.  The tidal flow in and of itself is impressive to watch. There are historic shell mounds from the Yaqui or Seri people that lived here before European colonization of the area.

itemReviewed.name: Estero el Soldado, Area Natural Protegida

address.streetAddress: Carretera las Tinajas - Guaymas Kilómetro 1.8 a la derecha, con estacionamiento

399706600.name: Absolutely worth seeing!
399706600.author: a TripAdvisor user
399706600.reviewBody: My family visited San Carlos 7/19 - 7/23 and Estero del Soldado was the last gem we visited before finalizing our trip. It was absolutely beautiful! We spent about and hour and a half kayaking through the estero and learning the environmental value this "sea nursery" has for the ecosystem.  The guides were helpful, knowledgeable and friendly. Highly recommended! I\'m looking forward to my next visit!\n(My pictures won\'t do this place justice as my phone is cracked and it was inside a ziploc plastic bag for safety)

itemReviewed.name: Estero el Soldado, Area Natural Protegida

address.streetAddress: Carretera las Tinajas - Guaymas Kilómetro 1.8 a la derecha, con estacionamiento

670732921.name: conocer
670732921.author: a TripAdvisor user
670732921.reviewBody: como se puede llegar hasta ah\u00ed?\nsiempre viajo a san carlos y nunca habia escuchado de el, me gustaria que me ayudaran a obtener mas informaci\u00f3n para llegar a este lugar

address.streetAddress: Rancho Nuevo predio 23

642205539.name: Grupo escolar
642205539.author: a TripAdvisor user
642205539.reviewBody: Lugar para ser visitado y disfrutar del ambiente, lo caracteriza su sendero rocoso, mucho ejercicio!

address.streetAddress: Rancho Nuevo predio 23

580174284.name: Paisajes en estado natural
580174284.author: a TripAdvisor user
580174284.reviewBody: El lugar est\u00e1 en conservaci\u00f3n natural, ya que no hay nada que perturbe ageno a lo del medio! Es un microecosistema, monta\u00f1a con espacios de palmeras y \u00e1rboles grandes al final un oasis secreto recomendaci\u00f3n ir con un gu\u00eda!

address.streetAddress: Rancho Nuevo predio 23

546709620.name: This canyon is NOT in San Carlos Sonora
546709620.author: a TripAdvisor user
546709620.reviewBody: Had to look this up..found it is east of Puerto Vallarta. \nPut this up so you do not have to do the googling....

352189995.name: Sonora\'s next resort destination
352189995.author: a TripAdvisor user
352189995.reviewBody: While much of Sonora is characterized by arid desert and interminable flatness, San Carlos (pop. 7,500) is situated at the convergence of the mountains and the Sea of Cortez, creating dramatic landscapes, a diverse ecosystem and the ideal place for a secluded retreat within the near reaches of civilization

334690497.name: it\'s a hike!
334690497.author: a TripAdvisor user
334690497.reviewBody: great views. EXCELLENT FOR TAKING PICTURES!  but this is for the person who enjoys hiking in the rocks and more of a rugged terrain.

642329891.name: Fishing
642329891.author: a TripAdvisor user
642329891.reviewBody:
Go and visit San Oedro Island from San Carlis on a Fishing boat 
Well w or th the trip with the views of fish is beautiful along with Whale watching in the Summer
Fishing trips are a must
City Cruncher PB

595426738.name: Long boat trip but great diving
595426738.author: a TripAdvisor user
595426738.reviewBody: The boat trip out to the island takes about 1.5 hours (in good weather) from the San Carlos Marina. If you make the trip, you\'re rewarded with great diving. On good days, visibility is over 70 ft. The sea lions like to come play, and there are lots of great dive spots around the island. Your captain will pick dive sites based on the winds, but there\'s something at every site to explore!

477294161.name: "Unbeilable sunsets and great beaches"
477294161.author: a TripAdvisor user
477294161.reviewBody: The walk to the Island we took the beach walk. Calm waters and lot\'s of sand. \nOnce on the Island we spent just an hour enjoying the views. As we were leaving the Island\nwe experienced the most beautiful sunset ever.

449343683.name: Great place to snorkel or scuba dive
449343683.author: a TripAdvisor user
449343683.reviewBody: We chartered a boat with Ocean Spirit and had a grand time with kids and grandkids snorkeling and scuba diving with the seals.  They will come right up to you and look you in the eyes.

429425312.name: Disappointing scuba dive experience
429425312.author: a TripAdvisor user
429425312.reviewBody: We were led to believe the 2-hour boat ride to the island would be rewarded with world class diving experiences. The three dives were shallow (35 - 40 ft), mostly dead coral floor, a few schools of angels, starfish, and 1 moray. Only fun thing was diving & swimming with the sea lions. Not the \'aquarium\' diving experience it was hyped up to be. Saw just as much (or little) snorkeling. The island is all rock with no shore so don\'t have any expectation of going ashore.

427090000.name: Lots of friendly sea lions
427090000.author: a TripAdvisor user
427090000.reviewBody: The visibility for diving here ranges from poor (30 feet) to good (maybe 50-60).  Rocky bottom with interesting critters.

415413667.name: Scuba diving
415413667.author: a TripAdvisor user
415413667.reviewBody: We went scuba diving here with Gary\'s dive shop and it was excellent. The crew were great and the fish tacos were excellent. I can\'t say enough about the great help the crew was in getting us ready and preparing all of our gear.

414282970.name: This is why scuba divers come to San Carlos
414282970.author: a TripAdvisor user
414282970.reviewBody: About 2 hours by boat (depending on the boat...), this is why scuba divers come to San Carlos.  Always a protected mooring somewhere, this island offers tons of sea lions, turtles, and an amazing array of undersea life.

393543774.name: Interesting to see.
393543774.author: a TripAdvisor user
393543774.reviewBody: It is a lot larger than it looks from land.  16 miles out.  A lot of sea lions and a good place to snorkel if you can stay out of the wind.

346811590.name: World class dive sites
346811590.author: a TripAdvisor user
346811590.reviewBody: San Pedro Nolasco Island is home to hundreds of friendly sea lions. The Lighthouse site is one of the most visited, but don\'t miss the La Lobera site just a few hundred meters to the northwest. The Wall at the North Point is a MUST see for more advanced divers. It\'s important to stop by one of the local dive centers to get the most up-to-date information about travel to the island.

661647838.name: Beautiful place
661647838.author: a TripAdvisor user
661647838.reviewBody: For outdoor enthusiast is a highly recommended tour self guided or with a park guide. Try to visit early in the morning if going in summer and go to the "ojo de agua" point it is a 2 hour hick well worth it.

654193136.name: Hiking in a Time Machine
654193136.author: a TripAdvisor user
654193136.reviewBody: Fabulous geological location...diverse rocks and plants.  A series of rugged trails, zip lines, birding. Entrance fee of 50 pesos- $2.50. Secure parking.

653792417.name: We went off the beaten path...
653792417.author: a TripAdvisor user
653792417.reviewBody: This is a beautiful place where you can enjoy nature. You can take it easy, but we went off the beaten path by mistake and ended up in an scary and fun adventure. The beauty of the desert microclimates as it\'s best

650096989.name: Sanoran Oasis
650096989.author: a TripAdvisor user
650096989.reviewBody: Interesting hike, not too long.  The pools at the end are reached by climbing a rope ladder.  There are also a lot of zip lines cris crossing the canyon.  Entry fee is $5.00 U.S.

606694973.name: Beautiful
606694973.author: a TripAdvisor user
606694973.reviewBody: Primitive, but beautiful canyon.  Unimproved roads are rutty and bumpy.  Don\'t go at night, use good judgment.

582921054.name: They are closed at surprising times
582921054.author: a TripAdvisor user
582921054.reviewBody: I drove out there to hike around 9:30am a few days ago.  After a 5km drive on a dusty dirt road, I found that it was closed.  There were no signs, however...just a chain link fence that was locked.

566728112.name: Great hike for adventurous family
566728112.author: a TripAdvisor user
566728112.reviewBody:
This was easily one of the most interesting and memorable hikes our family has been on. It had something for everyone. There were tunnels and caves to explore along with beautiful palm trees and cactus. And if you are into geology  you will love it. There are a few small water holes but sadly no flowing water for waterfalls in March. Those must be during the winter months. 
Now to share the tips and info. 
The cost to hike is 30 pesos per person. I didn’t see a way to pay with credit card. 
I would say it starts easy and goes to moderate with a few strenuous stretches in there. My husband and I are in our early 50’s with 3 kids from 12-19. We are mostly
moderate hikers and this place was the perfect adventure. I often wear hiking sandals but glad I had hiking shoes on to keep the small pebbles out. 
We hiked on a weekday so there was no zip-lining but there were also hardly any others on the trail which was a plus for us. 
Listen to instructions about the trails (spoken in broken English) it helped us understand what to do. 
After hiking about 700 meters the trail forks and you have 2 options. Both trails have a dead-end. This is not a loop. We went up the trial on the right first. It ends after climb up the tunnel. (Which isn’t easy to find through the trees.) Then we came back to the fork and went up the left side to the oasis. This is the most strenuous trail. This is where the ladder part comes in. It’s cabled into the rock so we felt comfortable going up. After this there are lots of large boulders to climb around and over to get to the oasis. I’m glad we were the only ones on the trail at this point so we were able to take our time. 
Bring lots of water and go first thing in the morning to avoid the heat and sun. We hiked on an overcast day so the weather was perfect. 
We spent about 2 1/2 hours but we took our time and explored both trails. We would have lingered even longer if we had brought snacks for the trail. Kids get hungry while hiking! 
If you are in San Carlos and have an extra morning don’t miss this adventure. It exceeded our expectations!

565900152.name: pretty canyon.
565900152.author: a TripAdvisor user
565900152.reviewBody: Easy to get too with a car, pretty canyon with great views to the Sea of Cortez, hours open can change quickly so go in the morning.

562798486.name: Absolutely beautiful.
562798486.author: a TripAdvisor user
562798486.reviewBody: Costs 30pesos per persons. Well worth it. Wear good shoes. There are 2 main trails. The one to the right is longer and ultimately leads out of the Canyon past the ranch and back to the parking lot. Both trails can be challenging at times. Climbing over boulders. There is also a ladder to climb to get to the end of the trail to the left. Well cared for area.

562193004.name: Vacation in paradise
562193004.author: a TripAdvisor user
562193004.reviewBody: Scenic beauty galore. A fabulous place to hike but challenging for those with balance issues. Hiking poles are helpful here. The drive out from San Carlos is a bit rough but doable, even in our Prius.

559809154.name: Worth the Visit
559809154.author: a TripAdvisor user
559809154.reviewBody: A short serpentine drive from the San Carlos strip brings you to this natural canyon.  There is a Zip Trek line set up for weekend use.  We went during the week and hiked the canyon.  A lot of different rock formations to be seen as well as the fauna.  It is worth the visit and you can spend an hour or most of the day to go as far as you wish. Use good footwear and take water.  There is a small charge of 30 pesos to access the trail.

555587661.name: Well Worth the Admission
555587661.author: a TripAdvisor user
555587661.reviewBody: You can spend at least 2 hours here. Gravel road to get there, but worth the trip. Go in the morning before it heats up.  Very interesting place, especially if you are into rocks and geology.

554176577.name: So Much Fun
554176577.author: a TripAdvisor user
554176577.reviewBody: 3 adults ( 2 30\'s & 1 50 something) we went about 11 am or so, not at all crowded.  We did all 5 zip lines, it was my very first time and I had a blast.  The climb to the top is a little strenuous, good shoes are recommended.  There are 2 guides that go and even though they speak little English, I felt they were thorough and safety- conscious.  My only real issue is that traveling from the end of one zip line to the beginning of another, there was a rope "bridge" for one and a log "crossing" for another.  We were roped to a safety line at all times but the guides seem to think it\'s fun to shake and bounce the crossings, making it difficult to cross smoothly.  Doesn\'t matter what you say to them, they pretend not to understand and keep doing it until you reach the other side. Other than that I completely enjoyed my very first zip line experience.

553838566.name: Easy hike
553838566.author: a TripAdvisor user
553838566.reviewBody: It was nice to see palm trees and senita cacti on one trail. The hike was not difficult for me except climbing the ladder added a little challenge. We went at mid morning and most hike was under shade.

548234823.name: beautiful place
548234823.author: a TripAdvisor user
548234823.reviewBody: This is a very beautiful place, definitely worth the trip.  I went on a quiet wednesday morning and enjoyed a nice hike with my dog.  They do require leashes

534974756.name: Blistering in the summer, water comes and goes, pretty low-key
534974756.author: a TripAdvisor user
534974756.reviewBody: This is a cool if truncated little canyon just outside of San Carlos, Sonora. It\'s got water - usually - but don\'t count on it. There\'s an interesting little pool with pond scum and water bugs, and a very dangerous rope ladder thing hanging nearby which is good for the foolhardy and the adventuresome. Lots of parking, updated facilities, and when we were there there was a parking guard. This is pretty basic though. Bring drinking water. Not good for anyone who can\'t scramble over rocks and around logs.

533593673.name: Interesting Hike!
533593673.author: a TripAdvisor user
533593673.reviewBody: We did this on our own and nothing to do with the Zip Lining etc., we just wanted a hike for exercise.  Go early and bring water for sure.  60 pesos for the two of us, and then the adventure begins, because there\'s no map and we couldn\'t fully understand the Spanish speaking Native American that collected the dinero (our fault, not his!)!!  There are two paths to choose from after you get about 10-15 min in there.  We started on the right one and followed up the best we could (honestly, we\'re not sure how much farther it went as we hit a type of "dead end" after about 15 min up that, so we backed down and went up the other side).  Cool looking palm trees and a small water fall.  A nice adventure that we followed up with some tacos and a great swim at the beach!

495473863.name: Worth it !
495473863.author: a TripAdvisor user
495473863.reviewBody: Totally loved this place! Everyone was super friendly and patient because we don\'t speak the language and we had to use google translate app.. Great experience for the kids! the staff were great guides for an awesome first time zipline experience!!!

487716485.name: Good Hiking and Ziplining
487716485.author: a TripAdvisor user
487716485.reviewBody: Nacapule canyon is not too far from San Carlos and offers great hiking, beautiful scenery and ziplining.  The red rocks and green vegetation make the canyon stand out and really "pop" against the typical blue skies.  They also have ziplining on weekends (we went on a Saturday) for very reasonable rates.  The most extensive package was 5 zip lines for $500 pesos; we did this and it was worth it.  It took about an hour and starts with a climb up a rock wall with two experienced guides.  It was very safe and well maintained, but moderately difficult.  The cheapest option was one line for about $115 pesos.  I\'d highly recommend hiking and trying the zip lines.

487549821.name: Aventure
487549821.author: a TripAdvisor user
487549821.reviewBody: This is a family friendly adventurous spot. They offer 3-4 different levels of zip lining. While you wait for your group you can take a hike in between the canyon. Reasonable prices, semi difficult to find the spot, just follow the signs, dirt road 95% of the way.

484746419.name: Superb Hike. Just take lots of water.
484746419.author: a TripAdvisor user
484746419.reviewBody: Most excellent hike. Fantastic cliffs and rugged scenery. Felt safe the whole time I was there. Wear good shoes or boots, not flipflops or sandals.

474387212.name: Oasis in the desert
474387212.author: a TripAdvisor user
474387212.reviewBody: Who\'d expect lush green palms surrounding a hidden pool high in the Sonoran desert? A pleasant hike along a marked trail filled with assorted beautiful rocks brings you to just such a spot.  Cool off and then head down on the same path or another way.

467898916.name: Ojo de Agua- quick but rewarding!
467898916.author: a TripAdvisor user
467898916.reviewBody: There are two trails you can take into Nacapule. We took the Ojo de Agua trail, which was short (about 45 min if you go at a decent pace) but very lush. I\'m always amazed by the biodiversity in Nacapule Canyon. It is $30MXN to get in, which I didn\'t remember from last time, but they have added some zipline and rappelling activities that make for a great time if you\'re up to it! I can\'t wait to go back and take the other trail all the way around the canyon!

463802466.name: Beautiful canyon, good short hike
463802466.author: a TripAdvisor user
463802466.reviewBody: Always a nice hike, but be prepared to climb around, over and through patches of boulders.  Up to the top where there is a beautiful view and down the other side can easily be done in 2 hours.  Note that you cannot enter the canyon to hike on Mondays, there is a 20 peso entry fee per person and there is a zipline available to do on Saturday and Sundays only.

458185569.name: Canyon hiking
458185569.author: a TripAdvisor user
458185569.reviewBody: We enjoyed a great hike up to the falls. You can do some zip lining in the canyon. Our high light was spotting a little coral snake. Of course we let the little poisonous guy do what he wanted to do.

455038276.name: Scenic adventure
455038276.author: a TripAdvisor user
455038276.reviewBody: This is a great place to hike and get outdoors. The scenery is beautiful. They also offer rock climbing, ziplines and other adventures. The staff is fun and well trained.

452837385.name: Nice cool hike
452837385.author: a TripAdvisor user
452837385.reviewBody: Hiked for about an hour. Glad we had our sticks for navigating up & down the larger rocks. Nice & cool temperatures in among the palm trees.

433035336.name: n our back yard
433035336.author: a TripAdvisor user
433035336.reviewBody: We went for a easy ride up the canyon, they have zip lining, and a lot to do  there, a lot of locals go there for the day

429219794.name: Unique surreal hiking spot
429219794.author: a TripAdvisor user
429219794.reviewBody: Like a trip to Middle Earth. BEAUTIFUL hiking/riding spot with plants and scenery only found in this little oasis. My favorite spot for horse rides and picnics.

427668542.name: Awesome hiking
427668542.author: a TripAdvisor user
427668542.reviewBody: When I am in San Carlos, this is one of my favorite places to go for hiking . Have done all the more easy ways , but even the more difficult ones . Best time to go is during the winter times, Summer would be too much heat at lest for me.

417662436.name: Great family activity
417662436.author: a TripAdvisor user
417662436.reviewBody: Great place to visit with teenagers, my girls loved it!\nThe guide was so nice, next time we go there we want to hire a guide to take us into the canyon all the way to the top.

405472807.name: Nature at its best
405472807.author: a TripAdvisor user
405472807.reviewBody: Beautiful place. Trails do not interfere a lot with nature. It a beautiful area with many varieties of vegetation, awesome vistas and a wonderful opportunity to make some exercise. In order to get to the pools you need to be fairly agile, with knees in good condition.

399709698.name: Absolutely amazing!
399709698.author: a TripAdvisor user
399709698.reviewBody: We visited San Carlos 7/19/2016 - 7/23/2016 and the Nacapule Canyon was our adventure for our 2nd day there. It was absolutely gorgeous!  The scenery there was desertic, but after a 1km hike you get to a palm oasis where the temperature drops. We were only able to do a small circut at the time as it was a very hot day (100\u00b0) and I didn\'t want my kiddos to over do it but my they enjoyed the zipline  soooo very much! We felt safe at all times and the lady at the front desk was informative, friendly and super polite! She truly was the MVP (as they were super packed that day and she never lost her cool)

387949861.name: zipline experience
387949861.author: a TripAdvisor user
387949861.reviewBody:
We took two trips out to Nacapule Canyon, one for hiking and the other for the zip line. Our first trip was for hiking. No one was there, during the week, so we hopped the fence. If they had had an envelope and a place to insert our twenty peso fee, per person, we would have paid. But, they didn't so we entered for free. 

I thought I had died and gone to heaven. To view this beautiful canyon with native palms together with native organ pipe cactus is unbelievable, and certainly worth the trip alone. 

We called the San Carlos tourist office and learned that the zip line is only open during weekends (beginning at around 8 AM) or, if there is a group, then by appointment during the week. So we arrived at 8 AM, and the staff arrived shortly thereafter. 

After setting up, we were ready to go. They have a number of options for you at various prices. They have five zip lines in total that cross from one side of the canyon to the other. They also have two short rope bridges to cross, and an option to rappel. We opted for the four zip lines and two bridges. The cost per person was very reasonable, and much less expensive than one would pay in the US. Bring cash. 

They suit you up in the straps that you sit on, together with the two pulleys that go on the cables. They also provide a helmet and thick leather gloves. I was especially concerned about safety, so I asked a lot of questions. We had ziplined once before in Germany, and they provided training and a similar set of gear. The main difference, however was that in Germany, there was only one line and the staff did not go with you. (granted, the distances were much shorter in Germany). We had two staff members accompany us, which was very important. One staff member went first, then the other stayed and launched us. 

The other aspect that made this zip line very safe is that there are two lines. One main line, and one safety line. Each cable is attached to the canyon wall by three thick bolts. So, basically, there are six attachments in total, at each end. It appeared very safe to me. Also, the staff (we had Amarantha and Elei (sp?)) were great. They made sure we were attached to something at all times when we were high on the cliff side. We felt very safe and in good hands. If you survive, don't forget to tip the staff generously. 

We highly recommend this experience. For me, it was an experience of a lifetime. It was scary, safe, and FUN! In total, it took about an hour and a half for our family of four. There is a bit of a climb, so no flip flops obviously, also wear sensible clothes. English is spoken,

387611153.name: Beautiful Canyon in the middle of the desert!
387611153.author: a TripAdvisor user
387611153.reviewBody: Our family enjoyed this canyon.It is a hidden gem in the middle of the desert.It even has seasonal rainfalls. There are zip lines, and a variety of terrain.

373761281.name: Canyons Fun to Explore
373761281.author: a TripAdvisor user
373761281.reviewBody: I was surprised when we arrived we had to pay to hike into the canyon and were told it was privately owned.  I thought it was a public nature hike.  Also surprised to see the set up for zip line through part of the canyon. We did not see any other hikers the whole time we were there. Great place to see and experience a variety of plants, trees, cacti, rocks, and terrain.  It was also really cool to see the desert jack rabbits on the drive to the canyon.

368137078.name: Beautiful Hike
368137078.author: a TripAdvisor user
368137078.reviewBody: This hike branches into possibilities for one long diverse hike, which was our choice , or several smaller hikes. It\'s a scenic beautiful place to spend the day with hardly anyone there(weekday). We saw beautiful canyon views, went through caves and saw diverse scenery. The waterfalls was a bit of a disappointment as there was no water flowing when we were there. There are a few signs that explain some things along the way. The nacapule trees are beautiful. You have your choice of how difficult a hike you choose to do. We spent about 4 hours and covered most trails. Staying longer would have been less enjoyable due to heat.

348367982.name: plants, and rock views spectacular.
348367982.author: a TripAdvisor user
348367982.reviewBody: cool place on a hot day.  if you like to hike it is a dream spot.  beautiful, and unusual with all the desert landscape, and oasis

347265188.name: Late morning hike
347265188.author: a TripAdvisor user
347265188.reviewBody: Beautiful sights and a great mix of shade and sun, as well as diverse terrain. Bring extra water as it gets hotter than expected in the sunny spots.

344110549.name: Beautiful setting.
344110549.author: a TripAdvisor user
344110549.reviewBody: You need to be in fairly good physical condition if you want to experience all that Nacapule has to offer.\nYou can take a easy walk into the canyon, but you cant get into the back of either canyon without scrambling up and down rocky sections.  I suggest you go to the end of the canyon directly ahead to the west as you go into the canyon, then retrace your steps about halfway and head north into the second one. This has several ways in the same canyon to get to its head. You\'ll find caves to scramble through that take you in the same direction. At the head of this canyon you can backtrack, or head over the trail end down into the open valley, from the ranch house its about a 15 minute walk back to the car.

341568291.name: Beautiful,easy hike in canyon
341568291.author: a TripAdvisor user
341568291.reviewBody: Walking in  takes about 30 min to get to the fork in the road....take the left one or you will be hiking forever!  Fun rocks, and canyon views up close.  Walked with two hiking sticks as I had a total knee replacement.  a fun experience.

332031894.name: Palm trees in the desert, zip lines for adventure
332031894.author: a TripAdvisor user
332031894.reviewBody: This is a beautiful canyon for a short hike. You start out in desert vegetation and as you enter the canyon it turns into this beautiful green vegetation. Finally the locals are starting to realize the real gem this canyon is. Now there are other options like zip lines and we saw some mountain climbers. There are still areas where you have to bushwhack but fun for the kids. The hike is about a mile in so not bad for the small kids to enjoy.

322216605.name: Fun for all ages
322216605.author: a TripAdvisor user
322216605.reviewBody: We took this hike with another family and our kids. The kids ages ranged from 6 to 14. We had to help the little one a couple of times but we were all able to complete it.

317318845.name: The Desert Scenery is Wonderful
317318845.author: a TripAdvisor user
317318845.reviewBody: The mountains, desert and views are beautiful. the changing colours as the sun travels through the sky make the scenery ever changing. You will need good shoes for hiking and if you are pleased with the help you get from the park people, please tip. Quading outside the park is great as well.

311640782.name: Great family hiking
311640782.author: a TripAdvisor user
311640782.reviewBody: Great hike for a family outing.  Can be hot in the summer, but winter months are great.  Have a zipline we haven\'t tried yet.  Our 5 year old loved the boulders and climbing to get to waterfall.

309309248.name: Great early spring hike
309309248.author: a TripAdvisor user
309309248.reviewBody: We hiked the canyon in early March 2015.  Beautiful canyon, easy to medium hike in the lower parts, exotic plants seen in few places.  Hike gets more challenging after a mile or so as the canyon steepens.  There was a trickle of water in the little stream that widened a ways up.  The sprigs were pretty, cool and shady, which was nice as the hike got warm as the morning wore on.  The facilities at the parking area are basic, take your own tp for use in the funky bathroom.

288927132.name: Great short hike
288927132.author: a TripAdvisor user
288927132.reviewBody: Very scenic and short hike.  There are two hikes they are both short.  The ojo trail is more technical with a sketchy wooden rope ladder.  Definitely worth the drive out.  The signs are pretty good if your driving there yourself.  I can\'t imagine paying for a tour as there are informational signs in spanish and english along each trail.  It is 20 pesos per person to enter on your own..a much better deal than some of the tour prices.  We saw a large centipede thing and a couple bright red birds.

281007368.name: Beautiful hike
281007368.author: a TripAdvisor user
281007368.reviewBody: Nacapule Canyon is a great place to go for an afternoon hike and picnic.  It is not too difficult, but you can go further to find more challenging areas to scramble over large boulders.  Be sure to take plenty of sunscreen, water and food.

277652217.name: Very nice place for nature lovers, extremely hot in the summer
277652217.author: a TripAdvisor user
277652217.reviewBody: It is very close to San Carlos so you can get in and out easier than other places, very beautiful nature piece for nature lovers, no commodities on the actual canyon. Not suitable for inexperienced travelers, need to be safe, communicated and oriented since it is close to the small town but you can still get lost in the desert.

276961763.name: Amazing place!
276961763.author: a TripAdvisor user
276961763.reviewBody: A lovely place to visit, amazing to find so much vegetation in the desert. Highly recommended. If you have the opportunity to visit this small town in Sonora do it. The tour only takes a couple of hours but the experience is icredible.

261650280.name: Where the Desert Meets the Sea
261650280.author: a TripAdvisor user
261650280.reviewBody: A very nice hike into the desert with beautiful canyons, palm trees and lush oases!  Not recommended if you have problems walking on loose rocks or climbing through vegetation.

260193070.name: must see
260193070.author: a TripAdvisor user
260193070.reviewBody: Nice and safe place to go.  Amazing to find an oasis like that in what is seemingly the desert.  Keep walking as far as you can and it gets more exciting.  What you see might depend on when you go: wet season vs. dry season. Wear shoes, not flip flops.  Kids can make it no problem.  Drive slow on the way out because the road can be bumpy in areas.

255117487.name: MEDITATION IN A JUNGLE DESERT
255117487.author: a TripAdvisor user
255117487.reviewBody:
What a surprising combination it is, indeed. A place in the middle of the desertic area of Sonora, where millions of years ago there was an ocean over and now we get to see palm trees, and amazing caves to explore safely, taking basic precautions,of course. 

It was my wife and a couple of friends who went there, led by one of the main organizers of excursions in Guaymas, Sonora, who happens to be my friend, hehe. 

Recommended to go early morning before the noon Sun hits your face, or in the evening before it sets. The views are hypnotizing. And this is just the beginning. We have been told of other 'magical places' around here where a lot of UFO sightings due to energetic fields take place. 

I will let you know gladly!

253072754.name: Not quite opened yet, apparently
253072754.author: a TripAdvisor user
253072754.reviewBody: We visited on a Saturday morning around 10 a.m. and it appeared that the clean-up crew was just finishing up from the prior days activities.  There wasn\'t anything doing to attract our attention, so we left.  This is a very dry, desert, canyon with several palapas and several trails leading into the surrounding, rocky, mountains.  Apparently, when they are ready, there are entertainment opportunities here, but we didn\'t see them.  Maybe our arrival time wasn\'t auspicious?

248444062.name: Awesome hike!
248444062.author: a TripAdvisor user
248444062.reviewBody: Amazing scenery all the way.  We did the LONG hike which includes the first part up to the waterfall (which was dry other than water in the pools) and then took the other trail which was a long loop back to the parking lot.  Luckily we followed a couple of college kids that knew their way as this trail was not marked well and was much less traveled.  Not real strenuous but also not for those that are not in good shape.  There are sections that require pulling yourself up a shabby rope ladder and climbing over huge boulders and squeezing under cactus branches.  Glad we did it as the views were awesome.

247927263.name: AmazingJungle in the Desert
247927263.author: a TripAdvisor user
247927263.reviewBody: It\'s a somewhat difficult hike unless you like to scramble over big rocks. However, it is well worth the effort.

238331394.name: A good place to hike
238331394.author: a TripAdvisor user
238331394.reviewBody: The drive out there takes you away from all the tourist areas. The scenery is beautiful and there are interesting little houses and trailer areas to look at.

213108362.name: Beautifull attraction in San Carlos
213108362.author: a TripAdvisor user
213108362.reviewBody: its hard to get there, i had to rent an atv but it was definitely worth it, it\'s beautiful especially during raining season

211876337.name: Hiking in the desert
211876337.author: a TripAdvisor user
211876337.reviewBody: We came here a little late, 11:00 am, and the place was almost empty. I recommend coming earlier,for the intense heat in the area.\nI never expected this hiking in this area,it was stunning and a little hard for a beginner like me. But we really enjoyed the trail.

189741145.name: Beautiful Hiking
189741145.author: a TripAdvisor user
189741145.reviewBody: One of my favorite places to go hiking when I\'m in San Carlos! My family and I have a house in SC and we still do at least one hike everytime we go here. Beautiful views, awesome climbs, can\'t say enough about this little paradise in the desert!

186547280.name: Scenic Canyon
186547280.author: a TripAdvisor user
186547280.reviewBody: Beautiful canyon with lots of interesting vegetation.  At points we felt like we were traipsing through the jungle.  The trails are pretty rough, if you are not an outdoor/adventurer type you will not feel comfortable making through the entire canyon.  The trail is often hard to follow.  Nonetheless, most people could get a feel for the overall environment  on a easy trail.  We were charged 20 pesos each by a very unofficial looking guy as we entered the canyon.

186090373.name: New Zip line is fun.
186090373.author: a TripAdvisor user
186090373.reviewBody: Nacapule Canyon is a lovely hike just outside of San Carlos and they just installed a short, but fast zip line. Great for the kids and adults!

183166262.name: Cool oasis
183166262.author: a TripAdvisor user
183166262.reviewBody: This is a nice little hike back into a canyon oasis.  Palm trees and transient water pools make this a fun place to explore out in the desert.

182016697.name: Great hike into beautiful scenery!
182016697.author: a TripAdvisor user
182016697.reviewBody: After seeing a friend\'s photos of this area, I added it to my list of "must see" places when we make our annual trek to San Carlos.  The road is well marked so the canyon is easy to find, and the grounds, including picnic areas and restrooms, are well maintained by a couple of environmental groups.  The path is an easy walk at the beginning but gets rougher and rockier as you advance into the canyon.  You can learn a lot about its history and vegetation from signs placed along the trail.  Depending on the season of your visit, it\'d probably be best to make it an early morning adventure. Even though the canyon walls do provide shade, it can get pretty hot later in the day, . An attendant was present to collect a small fee of 20 pesos for each person choosing to go on the hike.  Pack your camera, of course, and plenty of water!

157311169.name: Impressive desert Oasis with wild palm trees
157311169.author: a TripAdvisor user
157311169.reviewBody:
Nacapule Canyon is an experience not to be missed, by hikers, and nature lovers alike.

As you venture into this captivating landscape, it feels like you are taking a step back in
time. It is quiet, and the air smells sugary and sweet, As you make your way up this immense
canyon, you encounter large boulders, with beautiful natural rock formations surrounded by
shrubbery and ancient, wild palm trees.

Knowing there is an Oasis to greet you at the end of this fascinating hike, makes it all 
worthwhile. One feels a sense of excitement, after seeing rock walls drizzling with cool water. 

Keep your eye out for a roped ladder against a big boulder near the end of the hike. Once you are at the top, you can
view this massive, ancient, and special  Canyon feeling a sense of accomplishment and glee.
